level.heading: GENERAL REQUIREMENTS FOR PERMIT ISSUANCE (ยง 20-201)

level.text: The Mayor may issue a permit upon finding the following:
That the applicant’s proposed equipment, facilities, and procedures are adequate to minimize to danger to public health and welfare;
That the issuance of the permit will not be inimical to the public health and welfare;
That the applicant has satisfied the applicable requirements for the requested permit established pursuant to this subtitle;

That the operation of the source will not prevent or interfere with the attainment and maintenance of any applicable national ambient air quality standard and will not result in the contravention of any provision of the Federal Clean Air Act or the regulations promulgated under the Act;
That the operation of the source will not result in the violation of any provision of this subtitle; and

That in the case of a major stationary source, that the continuous monitoring devices for opacity and for all pollutants for which the source is a major source are in operation, or in the case of a new source, will be in operation as of the time of start of operation of the source; Provided, that no emission monitoring equipment for a pollutant shall be required in a case where the emission of that pollutant is not subject to an emission standard under this subtitle, or where continuous monitoring device is not reasonably available.

level.heading: SOURCE
